arcade.util

Class Solver

  • java.lang.Object
    • arcade.util.Solver

  • public class Solver
extends java.lang.Object
    Static utility class implementing various numerical solvers.

    Implemented solvers include:

    • forward Euler: first-order method for ODEs
    • classic Runge–Kutta (RK4): fourth-order method for ODEs
    • Cash–Karp: adaptive step size method for ODEs
    • successive over-relaxation (SOR): variant of the Gauss–Seidel method for solving a linear system of equations
    Since:
    2.0
    Version:
    2.3.8

      Defines ODE equations for numerical solvers.

    • Method Detail

      • bisection

        public static double bisection(Solver.Function func,
                               double a,
                               double b)
        Finds root using bisection method.

        Root is found by repeatedly bisecting the interval and selecting the interval in which the function changes sign. If no root is found, the simulation will exit.

        Parameters:
        func - the function
        a - the lower bound on the interval
        b - the upper bound on the interval
        Returns:
        the root of the function

      • cashKarp

        public static double[] cashKarp(Solver.Equations eq,
                                double t0,
                                double[] y0,
                                double tf,
                                double h)
        Solves a system of ODEs using adaptive timestep Cash-Karp.
        Parameters:
        eq - the system of equations
        t0 - the initial time
        y0 - the array of initial values
        tf - the final time
        h - the time step
        Returns:
        the array of final values

      • denseSOR

        private static double[] denseSOR(double[][] A,
                                 double[] b,
                                 double[] x0)
        Solves linear system of equations using SOR with dense matrix representation.
        Parameters:
        A - the matrix of coefficients
        b - the right-hand side vector
        x0 - the initial guess for the left-hand side vector
        Returns:
        the vector of final values

      • SOR

        public static double[] SOR(double[][] A,
                           double[] b,
                           double[] x0)
        Solves a linear system of equations using successive over-relaxation.

        Based on matrix size, the algorithm with use a dense or sparse approach.

        Parameters:
        A - the matrix of coefficients
        b - the right-hand side vector
        x0 - the initial guess for the left-hand side vector
        Returns:
        the vector of final values
